鋜鋜鋜

鋜字的基本解释

鋜
zhuó
锁足：“黄鹤足仍鋜。”
镯子，套右脚腕上的环形装饰物：“在足日鋜，在臂曰钏。”

鋜
chuò
古同“镞2”。

鋜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhuó］
［《廣韻》士角切，入覺，崇。］
(1)锁足。
(2)指锁足的器具。
(3)镯子。套在脚腕上的装饰品。

鋜字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鋜； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1307第24
【廣韻】士角切【集韻】【韻會】仕角切，?音浞。足鈐。【玉篇】鎖足也。【韓愈·納涼聮句】靑雲路難近，黃鶴足仍鋜。　又【集韻】測角切，音娕。鋤也。本作鏃。

鋜字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鋜字的起名意思

暂无。

Yu
Basic explanation of words
Yu
zhuó
Lock the feet: "Yellow crane feet are still awkward."
Bracelet, set the ring ornament on the right ankle: "On the day of the day, you can say 钏 on the arm."
Yu
chuò
Ancient with "Yuan 2".
Yu
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhuó］
["Guangyun" Shijiao cuts, enters consciousness, and respects. ]
(1) Lock the foot.
(2) Refers to the device that locks the foot.
(3) Bracelets. Set of ornaments on the ankle.
Yu
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Xu Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　鋜; Kangxi strokes: 15; Page number: 1307-24
[Guangyun] Shijiao cut [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Shijiao cut,? Yinchan. Foot seal. [Jade articles] Lock your feet too. [Han Yu·Na Liang Yu Sentence] The road to Qianyun is difficult to approach, and the yellow crane's feet are still hungry.　[Jiyun] Angle measurement and cut, sound. Hoe too. This is for the arrow.
Yu
Source glyph
Font comparison: Song Ti, Mainland China
Taiwan Minutes
Japanese Ming Dynasty
Korean Ming Dynasty
Old glyph
Yu
Name meaning
Nothing.
zhuó
Izhuó
锁足 lock foot
青云路难近, 黄鹤足仍鋜。 --唐·韩愈、 孟郊《纳凉联句》
IIzhuó
(1) 锁足的器具 implement for locking foot
有如鱼含钩, 又如鹤受鋜。 --清·朱彝尊文
(2) 镯子 bracelet
在足曰鋜, 在臂曰钏。 --唐·慧琳《一切经音义》引《字书》
(3) 又如: 金鋜
